workflow.name: Generate scalable e-commerce product images with GPT-4 and NanoBanana Pro
workflow.description:
## üöÄ AI Image Generation Workflow ‚Äì Scalable E-commerce Product Images

This workflow automates the creation of high-quality, AI-generated product images using **NanoBanana Pro**.  
It analyzes multiple reference images, generates a professional photoshoot-style prompt, creates a new image, and stores the final result with a public URL for reuse.


![Workflow Overview](https://www.dr-firas.com/scalable_e.png)

---
üìÑ **Documentation**: [Notion Guide](https://automatisation.notion.site/Create-scalable-e-commerce-product-images-from-photos-using-NanoBanana-Pro-2e33d6550fd9808e8891f7d606b49df7?source=copy_link)

## üë§ Who is this for?

This workflow is designed for:

- E-commerce store owners  
- Digital marketers and growth teams  
- Creative agencies  
- Automation builders using n8n  
- Anyone who wants to generate scalable, consistent product images from existing photos  

No advanced coding skills are required.

---

## ‚ùì What problem does this workflow solve? / Use case

Creating professional product images at scale is expensive, slow, and inconsistent.

This workflow solves:
- Manual photoshoot costs  
- Inconsistent visual branding  
- Time wasted on prompt writing  
- Difficulty generating AI-ready public image URLs  
- Repetitive image upload and storage steps  

**Typical use case:**  
Transform 3 reference photos (model + product) into a studio-quality fashion image automatically.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è What this workflow does

1. Collects **exactly 3 images** via a form upload  
2. Validates inputs to ensure all required images are present  
3. Splits images into individual processing paths  
4. Uploads original images to Google Drive (permanent storage)  
5. Generates public, crawlable image URLs  
6. Analyzes each image using AI vision (GPT-4O)  
7. Aggregates image descriptions into a structured context  
8. Generates a professional photoshoot prompt using an AI agent  
9. Creates a new image via NanoBanana Pro 
10. Polls the API until the image generation is completed  
11. Downloads the final image as a binary file  
12. Uploads the final image to Google Drive  
13. Logs results (images + descriptions) into Google Sheets  

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Setup

### Required credentials
- Google Drive (OAuth)  
- Google Sheets (OAuth)  
- OpenAI API key  
- AtlasCloud API key  

### Required configuration
1. Replace all `<__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__>` fields:
   - Google Drive folder IDs  
   - Google Sheets document ID and sheet name  
   - AtlasCloud API key  
2. Ensure Google Drive folders have write permissions  
3. Confirm tmpfiles.org is reachable from your environment  

### Important notes
- The workflow expects **exactly 3 images**
- The final image is downloaded as binary before upload
- Public URLs are normalized to `https://tmpfiles.org/dl/...` for maximum AI compatibility

### üé• [Watch This Tutorial](https://youtu.be/EVIvyyoNrQE)

![SORA2 logo](https://www.dr-firas.com/scalle-e.png)

---
### üëã Need help or want to customize this?
üì© Contact: [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-firas/)  
üì∫ YouTube: [@DRFIRASS](https://www.youtube.com/@DRFIRASS)  
üöÄ Workshops: [Mes Ateliers n8n](https://hotm.art/formation-n8n)


### Need help customizing?
Contact me for consulting and support : [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-firas/) / [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCriIQI8uaoEro5FEnOpeidQ) / [üöÄ Mes Ateliers n8n  ](https://hotm.art/formation-n8n)

workflow.name: üí• Create scalable e-commerce product images using NanoBanana Pro

parameters.formDescription: Please upload exactly 3 images for AI-powered analysis

parameters.text: Describe the image in detail. Include: objects, people, setting, actions, colors, and any text visible.

parameters.content:
## Step 1: Input Validation
**Form Trigger** receives 3 images from user

**If** node checks all 3 images exist
- ‚úì True: Continue to processing
- ‚úó False: Return error message

For each image in parallel:
- **Upload file** ‚Üí Google Drive (permanent storage)
- **Analyze image** ‚Üí GPT-4O describes content
- **Build Public URL** ‚Üí tmpfiles.org (public access)

parameters.text:
=Your task is to create an image prompt following the system guidelines.  
Ensure that the reference image is represented as **accurately as possible**, including all text elements.  

Use the following inputs:  

- **IMAGES‚Äôs description:**  
{{ $json.allDescriptions }}

options.systemMessage:
=You output a prompt that is a variation of the prompt below. Follow this prompt exactly but just change:

-the hand positioning based on what makes sense for the product
-how the product is worn and where it is placed

everything else stays the same

***

Show a high fashion studio photoshoot image of this reference character as a photorealistic model wearing the featured apparel and product, captured as a full body shot. The model looks slightly past the camera with a bored expression and raised eyebrows. One hand is lifted, with two fingers interacting with or touching the featured product in a natural, stylish way.

The setting is a clean studio environment with a solid color background that matches the primary color of the character. The featured product is intentionally prominent.

The image is shot from a low angle, looking up at the subject to emphasize presence and dominance.

The photo is captured on Fuji Velvia film using a 55mm prime lens with hard flash lighting. Light is concentrated on the subject and softly fades toward the edges of the frame. The image is intentionally overexposed, with visible film grain and heavy oversaturation. Skin appears shiny, almost oily, and the featured product shows harsh white reflections that highlight its surface and form.

parameters.content:
## üöÄ AI Image Generation Workflow

This workflow generates studio-quality e-commerce product images from **exactly 3 reference photos** using AI vision and **NanoBanana Pro**.

## üîÑ How it works

1. A form collects **3 images**
2. Inputs are validated (missing files ‚Üí error)
3. Images are processed in parallel:
   - Stored in Google Drive  
   - Analyzed with AI vision (GPT-4O)  
   - Converted to public URLs
4. Descriptions are aggregated
5. An AI agent generates a photoshoot prompt
6. NanoBanana Pro creates the final image
7. The result is stored and logged

**Flow:**  
Form ‚Üí Validation ‚Üí Analysis ‚Üí Prompt ‚Üí Image ‚Üí Storage

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup steps

1. Add credentials:
   - Google Drive & Sheets (OAuth)  
   - OpenAI API key  
   - AtlasCloud API key
2. Replace all `<__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__>` fields
3. Ensure Drive folders are writable
4. Keep input limited to **3 images**

#  üìò Documentation  
- Access detailed setup instructions, API config, platform connection guides, and workflow customization tips:
üìé [Open the full documentation on Notion](https://automatisation.notion.site/Create-scalable-e-commerce-product-images-from-photos-using-NanoBanana-Pro-2e33d6550fd9808e8891f7d606b49df7?source=copy_link)

## Step 2:  Image Generation
**Aggregate descriptions** combines all 3 image descriptions

**AI Agent** (GPT-4.1-mini) creates a fashion photoshoot prompt:
- Uses image descriptions as input
- Outputs structured JSON with image_prompt field

**NanoBanana: Create Image** sends request to API
- Uses public image URLs and AI-generated prompt
- API ‚Üí www.atlascloud.ai

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
